title: China still considering giving lethal aid to Russia, White House says
Mystery surrounds death of heroic police officer who doubted official story of Oklahoma City bombing
Mystery surrounds death of heroic police officer who doubted official story of Oklahoma City bombing
Rare giant Jurassic-era insect was spotted at an Arkansas Walmart
description: An insect found on the side of a Fayetteville, Arkansas, big-box store has been identified as the species Polystoechotes punctata, which belongs to a family of insects that predates the dinosaurs.

title: Nikki Haley tells CPAC 'If you're tired of losing,' vote for me
description: CNN's Kristen Holmes reports on GOP presidential candidate Nikki Haley's speech at the 2023 CPAC, where she received a lukewarm response and some attendees chanted "Trump" afterward.

title: Jon Stewart to conservative state senator: 'you don't give a flying f**k'
description: In an interview about gun control with Oklahoma State Senator Nathan Dahm, Jon Stewart argues Daum's support of anti-drag show laws directly conflicts with the logic he uses for loosening gun restrictions.

title: Alex Murdaugh to spend life in prison for killing wife and son
description: • Video: Judge makes heartfelt statement before sentencing Alex Murdaugh

title: White House: China considering providing lethal aid to Russia
US Attorney General makes unannounced trip to Ukraine
description: Attorney General Merrick Garland made an unannounced trip to Ukraine on Friday, according to a Justice Department official.

title: Top Russian official's remark about Ukraine war draws laughter
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov drew laughter from a crowd in India when he falsely claimed the Russian invasion of Ukraine was actually launched against Russia.

title: Opinion: The toxic brew poisoning American society
description: In what should be a shocking bit of news even in a country where antisemitism, violence and wild conspiracy theories are becoming all-too common, a man was arrested for allegedly threatening to kill all the Jews in the Michigan government, the FBI said. The news, which was an important one for some outlets, including CNN, seemed to be downplayed by other major media organizations.

title: Judge condemns 'the monster' Alex Murdaugh became before sentencing him
description: Before giving his sentence, Judge Clifton Newman spoke of the opioid addiction that Alex Murdaugh admitted on the stand.

title: Kandinsky painting recovered by Holocaust victims' heirs sets auction record at nearly $45 million
description: A painting by Russian Modernist Wassily Kandinsky that once belonged to victims of the Nazi Holocaust, has sold for £37.2 million ($44.55 million) at Sotheby's in London.

title: Inside the Palestinian town that far-right Israeli minister wants 'erased'
description: A burning smell lingers in the air of Huwara.

title: Gunmen open fire at supermarket owned by Lionel Messi's in-laws
description: Two gunmen on a motorcycle opened fire at a supermarket owned by the in-laws of Argentina captain and Paris Saint-Germain striker Lionel Messi in Rosario, Argentina, on Thursday, according to police.

title: Tennessee governor signs ban on gender-affirming care for minors
description: Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee on Thursday signed a law that prohibits gender-affirming care for minors, the latest state to do so as part of a wider Republican-pushed effort nationwide.

title: Russia may run out of money in 2024, says oligarch
description: Russia could find itself with no money as soon as next year and needs foreign investment, outspoken Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska has said.

title: CNN goes to village far-right politician said should be 'erased'. See what we found
description: The village of Huwara has become ground zero in the violence by Israeli settlers against Palestinians that has escalated in recent weeks. Israel's far right finance minister said that it "needs to be erased" in comments that were met with condemnation by the US State Department. CNN traveled to Huwara to meet some of those who have witnessed Israeli violence and are scared to find out what could be next for their home.

title: Newly discovered chemicals are so deadly to fungi they are named after Keanu Reeves
description: It's not every day that effective fungus-killing compounds are discovered, so researchers in Germany knew their recent find needed a special name. Identifying and testing three natural compounds that proved lethal to fungi, they were so impressed they've named the chemicals after actor Keanu Reeves, a nod to how he eliminates villains in movies such as "John Wick" and "The Matrix."

title: King Charles' meeting with EU chief is being criticized. Here's why
description: Royals speak through actions more than words, which often leaves royal commentators reading into what they do without the benefit of an explanation. This week, it came down to a handshake.

title: What you need to know about the battle for Bakhmut
Long Covid is associated with significantly increased risk of death, heart and lung problems, study finds
description: As the nation anticipates the end of the Covid-19 public health emergency, new research is showing that some groups are still feeling the long-term impacts of the disease. In the year following infection, individuals who experience long Covid are at high risk for a range of adverse health outcomes, including a doubled risk of death, according to a new study published Friday in JAMA Health Forum.

title: Facebook revamps controversial content moderation process for VIPs
description: Facebook-parent Meta on Friday announced a revamp of its "cross-check" moderation system after facing criticism for giving VIPs special treatment by applying different review processes for VIP posts versus those from regular users.

title: More than half of the world will be overweight or obese by 2035, report predicts
description: More than half of the world's population will be overweight or obese by 2035 without significant action, according to a new report.

title: Chaka Khan takes issue with Rolling Stone's '200 Greatest Singers of All Time' list
description: Chaka Khan is not interested in being ranked.

title: Steven Spielberg speaks out against rise in antisemitism in the world
description: Steven Spielberg says he is finding the rise of antisemitism in the world today "kind of daring us to defy it."

title: Art Dubai is courting artists from the Global South
description: Faraz Ali has been attending Art Dubai as a spectator for a decade. But this year, he is finally getting the chance to exhibit his work at the art fair for the first time.

title: Boris Johnson faces damning new evidence in Partygate inquiry
description: Damning new evidence has been published as part of the inquiry that will determine whether or not former British Prime Minister Boris Johnson misled Parliament over his conduct during the so-called Partygate scandal.

title: BTS mastermind on K-pop deal: We're not 'trying to take over the whole industry'
description: The billionaire mastermind behind some of the world's biggest K-pop stars is pushing back on accusations that he's trying to monopolize the Korean music industry.

title: Politicians in this country next to Russia want to pass controversial law. A fight broke out in parliament
description: A debate turned physical as MPs discussed a controversial law which would require any organizations receiving more than 20% of their funding from overseas to register as a "foreign agent."

title: US agency assessment backing Covid lab leak theory raises more questions than answers -- and backlash from China
Alex Murdaugh faces sentencing for killing his wife and son
description: • See the moment verdict was read in Murdaugh trial

title: Alex Murdaugh to be sentenced on murder charges
California residents left stranded after unprecedented snowstorm
description: Some California residents remain trapped inside their homes after a winter storm dumped feet of snow across the Golden State, prompting Gov. Gavin Newsom to issue a state of emergency in 13 counties, including hard-hit San Bernardino County. CNN's Camila Bernal reports.

title: This European airline will introduce double beds in the sky
description: A private cocoon up in the sky, with even your own heating system that you can turn up and down at whim? That's what's on offer in the latest groundbreaking new first class suite unveiled by an airline.

title: Adani shares soar as US investor steps in
description: Shares in some of Indian billionaire Gautam Adani's companies soared Friday after a US private equity firm agreed to invest nearly $1.9 billion in his embattled conglomerate.

title: 'Get rid of the rats': NFL players rate teams and reveal some 'gross' details
description: Given the multi-billion dollar nature of the business, you might think that no expense would be spared in ensuring NFL players' every need is taken care of. If so, think again.

title: Legendary Duke coach Mike Krzyzewski on NCAA criticism and his life since retiring
description: Over his 42 seasons as head coach of the Duke Blue Devils, Mike Krzyzewski became synonymous with college basketball.

title: John Williams leaves door open for more film work after 'Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny'
description: Harrison Ford has said he intends to hang up his whip as Indiana Jones after the new film hits theaters, but famed film composer John Williams isn't so sure "Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny" will be his own last film adventure.

title: How the market has changed in the 20+ years I've covered it
description: There have been a LOT of changes on Wall Street since I first joined CNN in November 2001.

title: Billie Eilish says she's deleted all her social media apps
description: Billie Eilish says she has deleted her social media apps from her phone due to her complicated relationship with the internet.

title: Why Biden is only just about to face his first veto
description: Spend some time reading about how the presidential veto has fallen into disuse and you can't help but think it coincides with an era where the filibuster and other forms of Capitol Hill obstruction have been put on steroids.

title: Look of the Week: Pedro Pascal is the internet's 'Daddy' — and he's dressed for the part
description: This week, Pedro Pascal arrived at the red carpet premiere for the third season of Disney+ series "The Mandalorian" in Los Angeles in a lemon-hued collared Gucci shirt, gray wide-leg slacks and a mustard knit sweater tied across his shoulders. The look — curated by celebrity stylist Julie Ragolia — was topped off by a pair of oversized, 70s tortoise shell eyeglasses.

title: Women at high risk of ovarian cancer should consider fallopian tube removal, experts say
description: "Knowledge is power," says Samantha Carlucci, 26. The Ravena, New York, resident recently had a hysterectomy that included removing her fallopian tubes -- and believes it saved her life.

title: Dubai's emerging hip-hop scene is finding its voice
description: Think of the United Arab Emirates and you might not immediately think of hip-hop, but in recent years, Dubai has become home to a small and dedicated group of artists who rap in Arabic about local culture.

title: Nobel laureate Ales Beliatski sentenced to 10 years in prison by Belarusian court
description: Belarusian Nobel Peace Prize laureate Ales Beliatski was sentenced by a court in Minsk on Friday to 10 years in a maximum-security penal colony, Russia state news agency TASS reports. He was found guilty on the charge of smuggling, according to TASS.

title: You can now live on a cruise ship for $30,000 per year
description: Have you ever dreamed of giving it all up, leaving it all behind and hitting the road to escape all your responsibilities?

title: Cyclist Kateřina Nash avoids four-year doping ban after dog medicine contamination
description: Cyclist Kateřina Nash has avoided a four-year ban after the US Anti-Doping Agency (USADA) linked her positive drug test with medication she had been administering to her dog.

title: 'Hot dog hands' and a googly-eyed rock: 'Everything Everywhere All At Once' props raise over $500K
description: A pair of "hot dog hands," a Bluetooth headset for crossing between universes and a rock decorated with googly eyes were among the standout lots at one of the year's most unusual auctions.

title: Formula One: Why the new season could be more dramatic than ever
description: A new season and much has changed, yet much also remains the same in Formula One.

title: Putin accuses Ukraine of 'terrorist attack' in Russia. CNN investigates the claim
description: Putin alleges a small group of armed Ukrainians have crossed into the Byransk region in Russia. CNN cannot independently verify the claims but Ukrainian authorities have denied any involvement. CNN's Frederik Pleitgen has more from Moscow.

title: Hear audio of what happened in Greece moments before crash
description: A train station manager in Larissa, Greece, was arrested in connection with the train collision that resulted in dozens of deaths. Greek authorities released striking dispatch audio recordings that reveals one of the train drivers receiving instructions to ignore a red light. CNN's Nada Bashir reports.

title: Yao Ming caught in the cross-fire as Chinese basketball team leaves top league on eve of Covid reopening
description: The return of China's top basketball league to its normal season format following years of Covid disruptions has been marred in controversy after an abrupt no-show from one of its former championship-winning teams amid accusations of mistreatment by its star player.

title: Chinese city claims to have destroyed 1 billion pieces of personal data collected for Covid control
description: A Chinese city says it has destroyed a billion pieces of personal data collected during the pandemic, as local governments gradually dismantle their coronavirus surveillance and tracking systems after abandoning the country's controversial zero-Covid policy.

title: Police told CNN they hope to repair the bridge, a vital artery for the extraction of civilians and movement of supplies such as ammunition, in the coming days
description:
• 2 Americans arrested for allegedly sending aviation technology to Russia
• Russia planned Kherson torture centers, say international lawyers

title: US assessment backing Covid lab leak theory raises more questions than answers -- and backlash from China
description: The US Department of Energy's assessment that Covid-19 most likely emerged due to a laboratory accident in China has reignited fierce debate and attention on the question of how the pandemic began.

title: Ukraine war sends message to 'aggressors everywhere,' says Blinken at Quad meeting
description:
• Live: Russia and China reaffirm partnership after foreign ministers meet
• 2 Americans arrested for allegedly sending aviation technology to Russia

title: Ret. col. says strategic retreat may be wise for Ukraine
description: CNN military analyst Col. Cedric Leighton (ret.) explains why a strategic retreat by Ukrainian forces near Bakhmut could be their best option at this time.

title: Tiffany & Co. unveils BTS star Jimin as brand ambassador
description: As luxury brands continue to court South Korea's booming luxury market, Tiffany & Co. has unveiled K-pop star Jimin as its newest brand ambassador.

title: US slams Cambodian opposition figure's 'treason' sentence
description: A top Cambodian opposition figure was sentenced to 27 years of house arrest on Friday after being convicted of treason in a verdict the United States denounced as a "miscarriage of justice."

title: 2 Americans arrested for allegedly sending aviation technology to Russia
South Korea doesn't need nuclear weapons to face the North, prime minister says
Maryland mayor resigns after being arrested on 56 counts of child pornography
description: Patrick Wojahn, the mayor of College Park, Maryland, resigned after authorities arrested him on 56 counts of child pornography-related charges, Prince George's County Police Chief Malik Aziz said during a Thursday news conference with Jessica Garth, a representative from the State's Attorney's Office.

title: Russia planned Kherson torture centers, say international lawyers
Video shows aftermath of violent turbulence on airplane
description: A Lufthansa flight traveling from Texas, US, to Germany was diverted to Virginia's Washington Dulles International Airport because of turbulence that left some passengers injured.

title: US adds Chinese genetics firms to trade blacklist over surveillance allegations
description: The United States on Thursday added two subsidiaries of Chinese genetics company BGI to a trade blacklist over allegations it conducted genetic analysis and surveillance activities for Beijing, which Washington says was used to repress ethnic minorities in China.

title: Deep snow closes Yosemite and other California parks
description: One statistic pretty well tells the whole story: 15 feet (4.6 meters) of snow.

title: Expert: North Korea food crisis at its worst point in decades
description: Alarm bells are ringing regarding North Korea's food situation as Kim Jong Un convened a meeting to transform the country's farming capabilities this week.  South Korean officials believe there have been deaths due to starvation and experts point to an ever-worsening situation. Paula Hancocks reports.

title: Fall of the Murdaughs: A timeline of deaths, alleged embezzlement and an insurance scam
description: For 87 years, the Murdaugh family name came to represent a legal dynasty in coastal South Carolina, where three successive generations controlled the local prosecutor's office.

title: Porn Zoom bomb forces cancellation of US Fed Reserve event
description: A virtual event with Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller was canceled on Thursday after the Zoom videoconference was "hijacked" by a participant who displayed pornographic images.

title: Researchers locate ship that was missing for more than 120 years
description: A 191-foot cargo ship was discovered by NOAA researchers over a century after it sank, taking the lives of all but two crew members.

title: Airships largely disappeared after several exploded. Now they're back
description: The smooth, white underbelly of the airborne whale sails across the sky, casting a shadow across the forest below.

title: The verdict was reached in the double murder trial of the former attorney after less than three hours of deliberations
Alex Murdaugh found guilty of murdering his wife and son
See the moment verdict was read in Murdaugh trial
description: The jury in the double murder trial of Alex Murdaugh has found him guilty of murdering his wife and son. The 54-year-old scion of a prominent and powerful family of local lawyers and solicitors, was also found guilty of two counts of possession of a weapon during the commission of a violent crime in the killings of Margaret "Maggie" Murdaugh and Paul Murdaugh on June 7, 2021.
